a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Child mortality vs. prevalence of stunting, 2022
Child mortality is the share of newborns who die before reaching the age of five. Prevalence of stunting is the
percentage of children under five with height-for-age more than two standard deviations below the median for
the global reference population aged 0-59 months.
Share of children who are stunted (% of children under 5)
Data source: United Nations Inter-agency Group for Child Mortality Estimation (2024); UNICEF; World Health Organization; World Bank
